abstract: More money for Internet access, less for movies by mail as companies face off.
snippet: More money for Internet access, less for movies by mail as companies face off.
lead_paragraph: Verizon sent me an e-mail last night to let me know about a “price adjustment” on my DSL service. The price is going up, of course, but I had to check my last bill to see how much: was $29.95, now $31.99.

headline.main: Competition Is Sometimes Good for You
